"\nTo begin, you can click the three dots at the top right corner and choose "
", copy and paste word lists you had found, or type the words directly. (If you copy and paste or type directly, remember to click "
" when you are done.)\n\nYou can save the lists by clicking the "
" button to load any previously saved list. The lists are saved in .txt format files which can be edited with text editors. When editing the files, make sure you do not change the keywords "
". Otherwise, the app will fail to load the files.\n\n"
" button at the bottom to start playing. You can also click the words on the list to start playing at that line. Click the "

" to stop.\n\nYou can click the language buttons at the top to choose what languages to speak. You can also set the speed of the speech, duration of the time delay between words, how many times to repeat each word, etc. on the "
" page. Click the three dots at the top right corner and choose "

The app uses Google's Text-to-Speech engine to produce the sound of the words. The pronunciation of the words is accurate in general but I cannot guarantee it is 100% correct. If you are in doubt about the pronunciation of certain words, please consult other reliable sources for clarification. If you find a significant error in the pronunciation of certain, consider reporting the word directly to Google.
"Some languages may have several pronunciations for the same word. For example, the Japanese word 内 can be pronounced as うち or ない. You can tell the app which pronunciation to use by using "
" to enclose the preferred pronunciation. For example, entering 内（うち）to the list will tell the app to pronounce うち.\n\n

When practicing sentences, the lists may not be able to display the whole sentences. In that case, you can press \"single-line mode\" at the top right corner to turn on the single-line mode. In this mode, only the words/sentences of the active line of the two languages are displayed using the whole screen. This makes sure the whole sentence can be seen.
